14.text: In the wake of a loss

27.text: The weight of your anger and forgiveness

35.text: You find yourself drained by the obvious strain

38.text: Of what's been lost to the wind

40.text:
And what little remains
So you pick up your pieces

44.text:
So as to gather your strength
For the love of your life

47.text: Yourself, my dear, needs a little self love

51.text: To make sense of your fear

56.text:
Imagine though in time
You meet people

61.text:
And places
Which will change your mind

65.text:
Teach you how to open your heart
Teach you how to forgive your kind

69.text:
Surely you can get what it's like
To be lost in a feeling

72.text:
To be happy or sad
In love or in mad

75.text: Yet we find it so overwhelming

83.text:
To just what it is
What we're busy breaking under

93.text:
On knowing just how life goes 
For conviction in that mind

97.text: Will stunt a healthy heart growth

102.text:
Encourage this bid
Forgive all of your neighbors

112.text: We know not what we did

115.text:
And it is with a heavy heart I admit
That too many times in my life

119.text: Whatever it was I lost it

123.text: And so now, with rage, I wave a warring fist to the sky

127.text: For wounds unsewn I had been treated unkind

131.text:
But my love for love and my love for life
I would find strength in my heart

135.text: And with my whole heart I would fight

137.text: Now life gives show to many a rocky pass but

139.text: so shall Earth cushion with her gentle meadow's grass

142.text: Aware that many have shared in unfortunate pains

144.text: It was my surrender to night that brought

146.text:
waking breath to my days
Having traveled the dark I had seen the skies

149.text:
So bright with stars
I fell to a cry

152.text:
From the most gentle of weeps came the most
violent of tears

156.text:
Exposing a broken man's hollow
And release

176.text: Or where credit is due so be thankful

181.text: Be thankful for the things you wouldn't think to
